member.name: P:Flattiverse.Connector.Controllable.Active
member.summary: Indictaes, if the controllable is active (registered to the game) or not. If this value is false, you already triggered the deregistration of the controllable or the server forced the deregistration due to a tournament start, server shutdown or due to disconnection of the player.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.Controllable.Shoot(Flattiverse.Connector.Vector,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)

summary.para: Shoots a shot. It can only handle one shot per tick per ship and has a buffer of one additional shot. Units generally can shoot only one shot per tick, so specifying 3 Shots in one tick will result in an error at the 3rd shot requested. The shot will be generated with the next tick. The server tries to anticipate, if you are able to shoot. However, this may not be possible. So the call to this method may be successfull but the shot may not be created, if you are out of energy, etc. Please observe Events like ResourceDepletedEvent to determine such situations.

listheader.description: The process is as described in the following steps.

item.term: The shot will be placed when the next tick is processed with time 1.
The next tick will change time to 0.
The next tick will delete the shot and create the explosion.
In the next tick the explosion is removed and deals the damage.

summary.para: This described process has been implemented for "a better gameflow". Please also note the corresponding minimum and maximum values for each of the parameters.

member.param: The direction in which you want to shoot. Calculated energy costs due to what the corresponding systems say are true for a exact forward shot. Shooting backwards the shot will cost 7 times the energy. Shooting 90 degrees sideways will cost 4 times the energy and so on. The length of this vector should be longer than 0.1.
The radius of the resulting explosion. Minimum value is 2.5.
The damage dealt of the explosion. Minimum value is 0.001.
The amount of ticks the shot will live, before exploding. Minimum value is 0.
member.exception: Wrong parameters may result in an exception, also if you don't have enough shots to shoot or if oyu don't have all of the required systems.
member.remarks: Please query the status of your weapon systems for the corresponding maximums (MaxValue) and energy costs: direction.Length is WeaponLauncher, load is WeaponPayloadRadius, damage is WeaponPayloadDamage and time is WeaponAmmunition.

member.name: T:Flattiverse.Connector.Events.AddedUnitEvent
member.summary: This event informs of the addition of a unit to the universeGroup.

member.name: F:Flattiverse.Connector.Events.ChatEvent.Source
member.summary: The player that sent the message.

member.summary: This event informs of the untimely demise of a controllable in the universeGroup.

member.summary: Notifies about the depletion and possibly overuse of a resource of your controllable.

member.name: T:Flattiverse.Connector.Events.EventKind
member.summary: Specifies the various event kinds for a better switch() experience.

member.name: F:Flattiverse.Connector.Events.EventKind.RAW
member.summary: A Fallback event for debugging purposes, if the event sent from the server is unknown to the connector.

member.name: F:Flattiverse.Connector.Events.EventKind.Failure
member.summary: This event indicates some critical out-of-game failure like a problem with the data-transport, etc.. Consider upgrading the connector if this happens and it is not due to a lost connection.

member.name: F:Flattiverse.Connector.Events.EventKind.UniverseGroupInfo
member.summary: This event notifies about the meta informations a UniverseGroup has, like Name, Description, Teams, Rules... You actually don't need to parse this event because it's also parsed by the connector and the results are presented in fields on the UniverseGroup.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.Network.Connection.close(System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketCloseStatus,System.String)
member.summary: Does whatever required to close the connection as properly as possible.
member.param: The status with what we close the connection.
The message to send to the endpoint.
member.returns: true, if the close has been executed "until the end", false if we wait for confirmation.

member.name: T:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe
member.summary: Represents an universe within your universe group.

member.name: F:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.ID
member.summary: The ID of the universe.

member.name: F:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.Name
member.summary: The name of the universe.

member.name: F:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.Group
member.summary: The UniverseGroup this object belongs to.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.SetUnit(System.String)
member.summary: Creates or updates a unit in the map of this universe group. The unit will be overwritten if the unit already exists (same name) and the colliding unit isn't a non editable unit like a player unit, shot or explosion.
member.param: The JSON formatted definition of the unit to create. Please refer to PROCOTOL.md for further information.
member.remarks: This method is only accessible if you are an administrator.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.RemoveUnit(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an unit from the universe.
member.param: The name of the unit.
member.returns: Nothing, or a GameException.
member.exception: Throws when trying to remove a non editable or non existing unit.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.GetRegions
member.summary: Retrieves the json definition of all systems in the universegroup.
member.returns: All systems.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.SetRegion(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates or updates a region in the map of this universe group. The region will be overwritten if the region already exists (same id).
member.param: The JSON formatted definition of the region to create. Please refer to PROCOTOL.md for further information.
member.remarks: This method is only accessible if you are an administrator.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.RemoveRegion(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes an unit from the universe.
member.param: The name of the unit.
member.returns: Nothing, or a GameException.
member.exception: Throws when trying to remove a non editable or non existing unit.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.Universe.GetUnitMapEditJson(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the json definition for the map editor of a unit from the universe.
member.param: The name of the unit.
member.returns: The map editable json string.
member.exception: Throws when trying to access a non editable unit.

member.name: T:Flattiverse.Connector.UniverseGroup
member.summary: Represents the main class. The UniverseGroup you connect to is managed by an instance of this class.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.UniverseGroup.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Connects to the specific UniverseGroup.
member.param: The URI of the Universegroup.
The auth key for UniverseGroup access.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.UniverseGroup.NewAsyncUniverseGroup(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Connects to the specific UniverseGroup asynchonously.
member.param: The URI of the Universegroup.
The auth key for UniverseGroup access.
member.returns: The connected UniverseGroup.

member.summary: Sets or adds the system. Systems with level 0 will be default systems a ship starts with. Systems which start at level 1 will have to be built by you.
member.param: The kind of the system.
The level of the system that this entry describes.
The energy cost of building this system in a ship.
The energy cost of building this system in a ship.
The iron cost of building this system in a ship.
The cabron cost of building this system in a ship.
The silicon cost of building this system in a ship.
The platinum cost of building this system in a ship.
The gold cost of building this system in a ship.
The time it takes to build this system.
The first effecting value this system has.
The second effecting value this system has.
The third effecting value this system has.
The increase in area of the ship using this system.
The increase in weight of the ship using this system.
member.returns: Nothing, or throws an error.

member.summary: Sets or adds the system. Systems with level 0 will be default systems a ship starts with. Systems which start at level 1 will have to be built by you.

The level of the system that this entry describes.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.UniverseGroup.TryGetControllable(System.String,Flattiverse.Connector.Controllable@)

The controllable or null, if not found.
member.returns: true, if the controllable has been found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.UniverseGroup.NewShip(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ship instantly. There is no building process or resource gathering involved. However, the number of ships that can be registered in this manner may be limited by the rules of the UniverseGroup. (See RegisterShipLimit.)
member.param: The name of the ship to be created.
member.returns: A controllable object that gives control over the ship.
member.exception: Thrown if the name is already in use or if the ship or RegisterShip limits are exceeded.
member.remarks: This will create a DEAD ship. To bring it to life, you need to call the Continue() method on the ship. Typically, you would call NewShip() followed by Continue() on the controllable.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.UniverseGroup.NextEvent
member.summary: Will return the next received event from queue or wait until the event has been received.
member.returns: The corresponding FlattiverseEvenet.

member.name: M:Flattiverse.Connector.UniverseGroup.Dispose
member.summary: Empties all resources.

member.summary: Checks the name.

member.returns: truw if the name is proper, false if the name doesn't pass the check.
